DOC.brief_summary: The thymus gland specialize organ chest plays central role adaptive immune system throughout development puberty . In response stress , fetal thymus gland may shrink , involute . The investigator propose prospective cohort study enroll pregnant woman admit labor delivery management preterm labor and/or preterm premature rupture membranes 28-36 week gestation . Based sonographic thymus measurement , investigator develop clinical prediction tool identify baby increase risk adverse neonatal outcome . A reliable non-invasive predictor adverse neonatal outcome use thymic ultrasound measurement potential affect clinical management , improve outcome premature baby , direct research effort .
DOC.brief_title: Fetal Thymus Involution Predictor Adverse Neonatal Outcomes
DOC.criteria: Singleton pregnancy 2836 week gestation Active spontaneous preterm labor symptom ( contraction , cervical dilatation and/or PPROM ) Nonsingleton pregnancies Gestational hypertension/preeclampsia Major fetal anomaly Known fetal aneuploidy Intrauterine Fetal Demise
